byline.contributor: Cara Buckley contributed reporting. Susan Beachy and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
byline.original: By JACQUELINE WILLIAMS and SERGE F. KOVALESKI

abstract: Pennsylvania investigators are looking into whether Pennsylvania State University mishandled case of filmmaker, writer and actor Nate Parker, former student who was charged in 1999 with raping fellow student; inquiry stems from continued examination of whether school's athletic department had pattern of inaction with respect to complaints of sexual misconduct; former university officials have been accused of failing to report sexual abuse of children by former football coach Jerry Sandusky.
lead_paragraph: Even though Mr. Parker was acquitted in 2001, a rape accusation from his college days has tarnished his Hollywood profile. Now his case has drawn the attention of investigators reviewing how Penn State handled complaints of sexual misconduct.
snippet: Even though Mr. Parker was acquitted in 2001, a rape accusation from his college days has tarnished his Hollywood profile. Now his case has drawn the attention of investigators reviewing how Penn State handled complaints of sexual misconduct....

headline.main: Nate Parker’s Past Surfaces in Prosecutors’ Investigation of Penn State
headline.print_headline: Actor’s Past Surfaces in Prosecutors’ Investigation of Penn State
